Module logsweet.watch¶

Real-time text file watcher supporting log rotation.

Based on: Log Watcher Python Recipe
From: Giampaolo Rodolà
Licensed under: MIT
Source: ActiveState Code Recipe 577968
class logsweet.watch.LogWatcher(file_glob: str, handler: Union[Callable[[str, Sequence[str]], None], Any], watch_cb: Optional[Callable[str, None]] = None, unwatch_cb: Optional[Callable[str, None]] = None, all_lines: bool = False, tail_lines: int = 0, chunk_size: int = 1048576, encoding: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Looks for changes in all files matching a glob pattern. This is useful for watching log file changes in real-time. It also supports files rotation.

Parameters:
  • file_glob (str) – A Unix shell style globbing pattern for the files to watch.
  • handler (Union[Callable[[str, Sequence[str]], None], Any]) –

    A function which is called every time one of the files being watched is updated; this is called with filename and lines arguments.

    Alternatively an object with a method notify_lines(filename, lines) and optionally the methods notify_watch(filename) and notify_unwatch(filename).

  • watch_cb (Optional[Callable[[str], None]]) – A function which is called every time a file has joined the set of watched files; this is called with a filename argument.
  • unwatch_cb (Optional[Callable[[str], None]]) – A function which is called every time a file has left the set of watched files; this is called with a filename argument.
  • all_lines (bool) – Read all existing lines before starting to watch new lines. Ignores tail_lines.
  • tail_lines (int) – Read last N lines from files being watched before starting.
  • chunk_size (int) – An approximation of the maximum number of bytes to read from a file on every ieration (as opposed to load the entire file in memory until EOF is reached). Is passed to file.readlines(). Defaults to 1MB.
  • encoding (Optional[str]) – The name of a character encoding to decode the text files. If None defaults to locale.getpreferredencoding().

Example:

def callback(filename, lines):
    for line in lines:
        print(filename, line)

lw = LogWatcher("/var/log/*.log", callback)
lw.watch()
watch(interval: float = 0.1, blocking: bool = True)[source]¶

Starts watching for new lines in matching files and for new or removed matching files.

Blocks until Ctrl + C is pressed, or SIGINT or SIGTERM is received by the process.

Parameters:
  • interval (float) – The polling interval in seconds.
  • blocking (bool) – If True is given, performs only one loop and then returns.
